intro: Coccoloba racemulosa, commonly known as the coastal beauty or sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to salty air and sandy soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in tropical and subtropical regions.
